   20: 
   21: -module(beam_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   24: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2, 
   25: 	 packed_registers/1, apply_last/1, apply_last_bif/1,
   26: 	 heap_sizes/1, big_lists/1, fconv/1,
   27:          select_val/1, select_tuple_arity/1,
   28:          swap_temp_apply/1, beam_init_yregs/1]).
   29: 
   30: -export([applied/2,swap_temp_applied/1]).
   31: 
   32: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   33: -include_lib("syntax_tools/include/merl.hrl").
   34: 
   35: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   36: 
   37: all() -> 
   38:     [packed_registers, apply_last, apply_last_bif,
   39:      heap_sizes, big_lists, fconv,
   40:      select_val, select_tuple_arity,
   41:      swap_temp_apply, beam_init_yregs].
   42: 
   43: groups() -> 
   44:     [].
   45: 
   46: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   47:     Config.
   48: 
   49: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   50:     ok.
   51: 
   52: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   53:     Config.
   54: 
   55: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   56:     Config.
   57: 
   58: 
   59: 
   60: %% Verify that apply(M, F, A) is really tail recursive.
   61: apply_last(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   62:     Pid  = spawn(?MODULE, applied, [self(), 10000]),
   63:     Size =
   64: 	receive
   65: 	    {Pid, finished} ->
   66: 		stack_size(Pid)
   67: 	after 30000 ->
   68: 		ct:fail("applied/2 timed out.")
   69: 	end,
   70:     Pid ! die,
   71:     io:format("Size: ~p~n", [Size]),
   72:     if
   73: 	Size < 700 ->
   74: 	    ok;
   75: 	true ->
   76: 	    ct:fail("10000 apply() grew stack too much.")
   77:     end,
   78:     ok.
   79: 
   80: stack_size(Pid) ->
   81:     {heap_size, HS}=process_info(Pid, heap_size),
   82:     {stack_size,SS}=process_info(Pid, stack_size),
   83:     HS+SS.
   84: 
   85: applied(Starter, 0) ->
   86:     Starter ! {self(), finished},
   87:     receive
   88: 	die ->
   89: 	    ok
   90:     end,
   91:     ok;
   92: applied(Starter, N) ->
   93:     apply(?MODULE, applied, [Starter, N-1]).
   94: 
   95: %% Verify that tail-recursive use of apply(M,F,A) on a Bif works."
   96: apply_last_bif(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   97:     apply(erlang, abs, [1]).
   98: 
   99: %% Test whether packing works properly.
  100: packed_registers(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  101:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
  102: 
  103:     %% Generate scrambled sequence.
  104:     Seq0 = [{erlang:phash2(I),I} || I <- lists:seq(0, 260)],
  105:     Seq = [I || {_,I} <- lists:sort(Seq0)],
  106: 
  107:     %% Generate a test modules that uses get_list/3 instructions
  108:     %% with high register numbers.
  109:     S0 = [begin
  110: 	      VarName = list_to_atom("V"++integer_to_list(V)),
  111: 	      {merl:var(VarName),V}
  112: 	  end || V <- Seq],
  113:     Vars = [V || {V,_} <- S0],
  114:     NewVars = [begin
  115: 		   VarName = list_to_atom("M"++integer_to_list(V)),
  116: 		   merl:var(VarName)
  117: 	       end || V <- Seq],
  118:     MoreNewVars = [begin
  119:                        VarName = list_to_atom("MM"++integer_to_list(V)),
  120:                        merl:var(VarName)
  121:                    end || V <- Seq],
  122:     TupleEls = [?Q("id(_@Value@)") || {_,Value} <- S0],
  123:     S = [?Q("_@Var = id(_@Value@)") || {Var,Value} <- S0],
  124:     Code = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n"
  125: 	       "-export([f/0]).\n"
  126: 	       "f() ->\n"
  127:                "Tuple = id({_@TupleEls}),\n"
  128:                "{_@MoreNewVars} = Tuple,\n"
  129: 	       "_@S,\n"
  130: 	       "_ = id(0),\n"
  131: 	       "L = [_@Vars],\n"
  132: 	       "_ = id(1),\n"
  133: 	       "[_@NewVars] = L,\n"		%Test get_list/3.
  134: 	       "_ = id(2),\n"
  135: 	       "id([_@Vars,_@NewVars,_@MoreNewVars]).\n"
  136: 	       "id(I) -> I.\n"]),
  137: 
  138:     merl:compile_and_load(Code, []),
  139: 
  140:     %% Optionally print the generated code.
  141:     PrintCode = false,                          %Change to true to print code.
  142: 
  143:     case PrintCode of
  144:         false ->
  145:             ok;
  146:         true ->
  147:             merl:print(Code),
  148:             erts_debug:df(Mod),
  149:             {ok,Dis} = file:read_file(atom_to_list(Mod)++".dis"),
  150:             io:put_chars(Dis)
  151:     end,
  152: 
  153:     %% Executing the generated code in freshly spawned process makes it much
  154:     %% more likely to crash if there is a bug in init_yregs.
  155:     CombinedSeq = Seq ++ Seq ++ Seq,
  156:     CombinedSeq = spawn_exec(fun Mod:f/0),
  157: 
  158:     %% Clean up.
  159:     true = code:delete(Mod),
  160:     false = code:purge(Mod),
  161:     ok.
  162: 
  163: heap_sizes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  164:     Sizes = erlang:system_info(heap_sizes),
  165:     io:format("~p heap sizes\n", [length(Sizes)]),
  166:     io:format("~p\n", [Sizes]),
  167: 
  168:     %% Verify that heap sizes increase monotonically.
  169:     Largest = lists:foldl(fun(E, P) when is_integer(P), E > P -> E;
  170: 				   (E, []) -> E
  171: 				end, [], Sizes),
  172: 
  173:     %% Verify that the largest heap size consists of
  174:     %%  - 31 bits of bytes on 32 bits arch
  175:     %%  - at least 52 bits of bytes (48 is the maximum virtual address)
  176:     %%    and at the most 63 bits on 64 bit archs
  177:     %% heap sizes are in words
  178:     case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
  179: 	8 ->
  180: 	    0    = (Largest*8) bsr 63,
  181: 	    true = (Largest*8) > (1 bsl 52);
  182: 	4 ->
  183: 	    1 = (Largest*4) bsr 31
  184:     end,
  185:     ok.
  186: 
  187: %% Thanks to Igor Goryachev.
  188: 
  189: big_lists(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  190:     b(),
  191:     ok.
  192: 
  193: a() ->
  194:     {selected,
  195:      ["uid",
  196:       "nickname",
  197:       "n_family",
  198:       "n_given",
  199:       "email_pref",
  200:       "tel_home_number",
  201:       "tel_cellular_number",
  202:       "adr_home_country",
  203:       "adr_home_locality",
  204:       "adr_home_region",
  205:       "url",
  206:       "gender",
  207:       "bday",
  208:       "constitution",
  209:       "height",
  210:       "weight",
  211:       "hair",
  212:       "routine",
  213:       "smoke",
  214:       "maritalstatus",
  215:       "children",
  216:       "independence",
  217:       "school_number",
  218:       "school_locality",
  219:       "school_title",
  220:       "school_period",
  221:       "org_orgname",
  222:       "title",
  223:       "adr_work_locality",
  224:       "photo_type",
  225:       "photo_binval"],
  226:      [{"test"}]}.
  227: 
  228: b() ->
  229:     case a() of
  230:         {selected,
  231:          ["uid",
  232:           "nickname",
  233:           "n_family",
  234:           "n_given",
  235:           "email_pref",
  236:           "tel_home_number",
  237:           "tel_cellular_number",
  238:           "adr_home_country",
  239:           "adr_home_locality",
  240:           "adr_home_region",
  241:           "url",
  242:           "gender",
  243:           "bday",
  244:           "constitution",
  245:           "height",
  246:           "weight",
  247:           "hair",
  248:           "routine",
  249:           "smoke",
  250:           "maritalstatus",
  251:           "children",
  252:           "independence",
  253:           "school_number",
  254:           "school_locality",
  255:           "school_title",
  256:           "school_period",
  257:           "org_orgname",
  258:           "title",
  259:           "adr_work_locality",
  260:           "photo_type",
  261:           "photo_binval"],
  262:          _} ->
  263: 	    ok
  264:     end.
  265: 
  266: fconv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  267:     do_fconv(atom),
  268:     do_fconv(nil),
  269:     do_fconv(tuple_literal),
  270:     3.0 = do_fconv(1.0, 2.0),
  271:     ok.
  272: 
  273: do_fconv(Type) ->
  274:     try
  275: 	do_fconv(Type, 1.0),
  276: 	ct:fail(no_badarith)
  277:     catch
  278: 	error:badarith ->
  279: 	    ok
  280:     end.
  281: 
  282: do_fconv(atom, Float) when is_float(Float) ->
  283:     Float + a;
  284: do_fconv(nil, Float) when is_float(Float) ->
  285:     Float + [];
  286: do_fconv(tuple_literal, Float) when is_float(Float) ->
  287:     Float + {a,b};
  288: do_fconv(A, B) when is_float(A), is_float(B) ->
  289:     A + B.
  290: 
  291: 
  292: select_val(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  293:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
  294: 
  295:     %% Test select_val instructions around interesting powers of 2.
  296:     Powers = lists:seq(0, 33) ++
  297:         lists:seq(47, 49) ++
  298:         lists:seq(58, 65) ++
  299:         lists:seq(8192 - 5, 8192 + 5),
  300:     L = make_tests(Powers, 0, []),
  301:     Code = make_module(Mod, L),
  302:     merl:compile_and_load(Code, []),
  303: 
  304:     %% Uncomment the following line to print the generated code.
  305:     %%merl:print(Code),
  306: 
  307:     verify(L, Mod),
  308: 
  309:     %% Clean up.
  310:     true = code:delete(Mod),
  311:     false = code:purge(Mod),
  312: 
  313:     ok.
  314: 
  315: verify([{F,L}|T], Mod) ->
  316:     verify_1(L, F, Mod),
  317: 
  318:     Sum = lists:sum([abs(V) || {V,_} <- L]),
  319:     expect_error(Mod, F, -Sum),
  320:     expect_error(Mod, F, Sum),
  321:     expect_error(Mod, F, not_an_integer),
  322: 
  323:     verify(T, Mod);
  324: verify([], _Mod) -> ok.
  325: 
  326: verify_1([{V,Exp}|T], F, Mod) ->
  327:     case Mod:F(V) of
  328:         Exp ->
  329:             verify_1(T, F, Mod);
  330:         Other ->
  331:             io:format("~p:~p(~p) evaluates to ~p; expected ~p",
  332:                       [Mod,F,V,Other,Exp]),
  333:             ct:fail(unexpected_value)
  334:     end;
  335: verify_1([], _, _) -> ok.
  336: 
  337: expect_error(M, F, V) ->
  338:     try M:F(V) of
  339:         UnexpectedSuccess ->
  340:             io:format("~p:~p(~p) evaluates to ~p; expected it to fail",
  341:                       [M,F,V,UnexpectedSuccess]),
  342:             ct:fail(unexpected_success)
  343:     catch error:function_clause:Stk ->
  344:             [{M,F,[V],_}|_] = Stk
  345:     end.
  346: 
  347: make_tests([P|Ps], N0, Acc0) ->
  348:     {Acc,N} = make_tests_1(1 bsl P, N0, Acc0),
  349:     make_tests(Ps, N, Acc);
  350: make_tests([], N0, Acc0) ->
  351:     %% Finally, generate some functions with a huge number of clauses.
  352: 
  353:     {Acc1, N1} = make_huge_bsearch(N0, Acc0),
  354:     {Acc, _N} = make_huge_jump_tab(N1, Acc1),
  355: 
  356:     lists:reverse(Acc).
  357: 
  358: make_tests_1(V, N0, Acc0) ->
  359:     {Acc,N} = make_tests_2(V, N0, Acc0),
  360:     make_tests_2(-V, N, Acc).
  361: 
  362: make_tests_2(V, N0, Acc0) ->
  363:     %% Because the values are not consecutive, a binary search will be
  364:     %% generated.
  365:     NumClauses = 14,
  366:     {Acc1,N1} = make_tests_3(V - NumClauses*5, V, NumClauses, 5, N0, Acc0),
  367: 
  368:     %% Test a binary search with 107 values.
  369:     {Acc,N} = make_test("bsearch", V - 5*50, V + 5*56, 5, N1, Acc1),
  370: 
  371:     %% Use consecutive values to allow a jump table to be used.
  372:     make_test("jump_tab", V - 10, V + 10, 1, N, Acc).
  373: 
  374: make_tests_3(_First, _Last, 0, _Step, N, Acc) ->
  375:     {Acc,N};
  376: make_tests_3(First, Last, NumClauses, Step, N0, Acc0) ->
  377:     {Acc,N} = make_test("f", First, Last, Step, N0, Acc0),
  378:     make_tests_3(First+Step, Last+Step, NumClauses-1, Step, N, Acc).
  379: 
  380: make_huge_jump_tab(N, Acc) ->
  381:     NC = 16384 + 1,
  382:     make_test("huge_jump_tab", 0, NC, 1, N, Acc).
  383: 
  384: make_huge_bsearch(N0, Acc) ->
  385:     NC = 2000,
  386: 
  387:     %% Let the last number be a bignum.
  388:     Last = 1 bsl (erlang:system_info(wordsize)*8 - 5),
  389:     Step = 5,
  390: 
  391:     make_test("huge_bsearch", Last - NC*Step, Last, Step, N0, Acc).
  392: 
  393: make_test(Prefix, First, Last, Step, N, Acc) ->
  394:     Name = list_to_atom(Prefix ++ integer_to_list(N)),
  395:     Seq = lists:seq(First, Last, Step),
  396:     L = [{I,erlang:phash2({I,N})} || I <- Seq],
  397:     {[{Name,L}|Acc],N+1}.
  398: 
  399: make_module(Mod, L) ->
  400:     ModDef = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@')."]),
  401:     Fs = make_funcs(L),
  402:     Xs = [{F,1} || {F,_} <- L],
  403:     Exported = [erl_syntax:arity_qualifier(merl:term(N), merl:term(A)) ||
  404:                    {N,A} <- Xs],
  405:     Export = ?Q("-export(['@_Exported'/1])."),
  406:     [ModDef, Export | Fs].
  407: 
  408: make_funcs([{Name,List}|T]) ->
  409:     [make_func(Name, List) | make_funcs(T)];
  410: make_funcs([]) -> [].
  411: 
  412: make_func(Name, List) ->
  413:     Cs = [?Q(["(_@I@) -> _@Body@"]) || {I,Body} <- List],
  414:     erl_syntax:function(erl_syntax:atom(Name), Cs).
  415: 
  416: select_tuple_arity(_Config) ->
  417:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
  418: 
  419:     {Vs,Cs} = make_tuple_tests(300, [], []),
  420:     Name = erl_syntax:atom(match_tuple),
  421:     F = erl_syntax:function(Name, Cs),
  422:     Code = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n"
  423:                "-export([match_tuple/1]).\n"]) ++ [F],
  424: 
  425:     merl:compile_and_load(Code, []),
  426: 
  427:     %% %% Uncomment the following line to print the generated code.
  428:     %% merl:print(Code),
  429: 
  430:     verify_tuple_match(Vs, Mod),
  431: 
  432:     %% Clean up.
  433:     true = code:delete(Mod),
  434:     false = code:purge(Mod),
  435: 
  436:     ok.
  437: 
  438: make_tuple_tests(0, Clauses, Acc) ->
  439:     {Acc,Clauses};
  440: make_tuple_tests(Size, Clauses, Acc) ->
  441:     V = erlang:phash2(Size),
  442:     Es = lists:duplicate(Size, erl_syntax:underscore()),
  443:     Tuple = erl_syntax:tuple(Es),
  444:     Value = erl_syntax:integer(V),
  445:     Clause = erl_syntax:clause([Tuple], [], [Value]),
  446:     make_tuple_tests(Size-1, [Clause|Clauses], [{Size,V}|Acc]).
  447: 
  448: verify_tuple_match([{Size,Result}|T], Mod) ->
  449:     Tuple = erlang:make_tuple(Size, a),
  450:     Result = Mod:match_tuple(Tuple),
  451:     verify_tuple_match(T, Mod);
  452: verify_tuple_match([], _) ->
  453:     ok.
  454: 
  455: swap_temp_apply(_Config) ->
  456:     {swap_temp_applied,42} = do_swap_temp_apply(41),
  457:     not_an_integer = do_swap_temp_apply(not_an_integer),
  458:     ok.
  459: 
  460: do_swap_temp_apply(Msg) ->
  461:     case swap_temp_apply_function(Msg) of
  462: 	undefined -> Msg;
  463: 	Type ->
  464: 	    %% The following sequence:
  465: 	    %%   move {x,0} {x,2}
  466: 	    %%   move {y,0} {x,0}
  467: 	    %%   move {x,2} {y,0}
  468: 	    %%   apply 1
  469: 	    %%
  470: 	    %% Would be incorrectly transformed to:
  471: 	    %%   swap {x,0} {y,0}
  472: 	    %%   apply 1
  473: 	    %%
  474: 	    %% ({x,1} is the module, {x,2} the function to be applied).
  475: 	    %%
  476: 	    %% If the instructions are to be transformed, the correct
  477: 	    %% transformation is:
  478: 	    %%
  479: 	    %%   swap_temp {x,0} {y,0} {x,2}
  480: 	    %%   apply 1
  481: 	    Fields = ?MODULE:Type(Msg),
  482: 	    {Type,Fields}
  483:     end.
  484: 
  485: swap_temp_apply_function(Int) when is_integer(Int) ->
  486:     swap_temp_applied;
  487: swap_temp_apply_function(_) ->
  488:     undefined.
  489: 
  490: swap_temp_applied(Int) ->
  491:     Int+1.
  492: 
  493: beam_init_yregs(Config) ->
  494:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  495:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
  496:     File = filename:join(DataDir, Mod),
  497:     {ok,Mod,Code} = compile:file(File, [from_asm,no_postopt,binary]),
  498:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, Mod, Code),
  499: 
  500:     _ = [ok = spawn_exec(fun Mod:Mod/0) || _ <- lists:seq(1, 10)],
  501: 
  502:     %% Clean up.
  503:     true = code:delete(Mod),
  504:     false = code:purge(Mod),
  505: 
  506:     ok.
  507: 
  508: %%% Common utilities.
  509: spawn_exec(F) ->
  510:     {Pid,Ref} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
  511:                                       exit(F())
  512:                               end),
  513:     receive
  514:         {'DOWN',Ref,process,Pid,Result} -> Result
  515:     end.
